validation_items.question: Is a comprehensive capability map documented showing current and proposed capabilities?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Capability map clearly identifies business capabilities with alignment to architecture components
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No capability map or capabilities not mapped to architecture components
validation_rules.na_criteria: Infrastructure-only project with no business capabilities
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Capability map not documented in Section 3 (Business Context)

validation_items.question: Are all applications and services mapped to business capabilities to identify coverage and gaps?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Applications mapped to capabilities with gap analysis showing coverage percentage and identified gaps
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No application-to-capability mapping or no gap analysis
validation_rules.na_criteria: Greenfield project with no existing applications
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Application coverage analysis not documented in Section 5 (Logical Architecture)

validation_items.question: Are redundant or overlapping capabilities identified with rationalization plans?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Redundancy analysis completed with decommissioning or consolidation roadmap for duplicate capabilities
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No redundancy assessment or overlapping capabilities not addressed
validation_rules.na_criteria: Single application project with no redundancy concerns
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Redundancy assessment not documented in Section 3 (Business Context)

validation_items.question: Are all third-party applications and COTS products documented with vendor and version details?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Complete inventory of third-party products with vendor name, version, licensing model, and support status
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No third-party inventory or incomplete vendor details
validation_rules.na_criteria: Fully custom-built solution with no third-party products
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Third-party inventory not documented in Section 8 (Technology Stack)

validation_items.question: Are all customizations to third-party applications documented with business justification?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Each customization documented with business justification, cost-benefit analysis, and alternatives considered (configuration vs. customization)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Customizations not documented or no business justification provided
validation_rules.na_criteria: No third-party applications or all used out-of-the-box
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Customization justification not documented in Section 12 (Architectural Decisions)

validation_items.question: Are third-party products integrated using standard interfaces (APIs, webhooks) rather than core customization?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Integration strategy prioritizes standard APIs, webhooks, and configuration over code-level customization
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Heavy reliance on core code customization without exploring standard integration options
validation_rules.na_criteria: No third-party product integration required
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Integration approach not documented in Section 8 (Technology Stack)

validation_items.question: Is cloud deployment the primary hosting model with on-premise only when justified?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Cloud-first approach documented with deployment to public/private cloud; on-premise deployment requires documented exception
validation_rules.fail_criteria: On-premise deployment without cloud evaluation or justification
validation_rules.na_criteria: Legacy system replacement with cloud migration planned
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Deployment model not documented in Section 4 (High-Level Architecture)

validation_items.question: Are cloud-native services (managed databases, serverless, containers) prioritized over IaaS?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Architecture leverages cloud-native PaaS/SaaS services (managed databases, serverless functions, container orchestration) with justification for any IaaS usage
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Heavy reliance on IaaS (virtual machines) without evaluating managed cloud services
validation_rules.na_criteria: On-premise deployment with documented exception
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Cloud service selection not documented in Section 8 (Technology Stack)

validation_items.question: Does the architecture comply with cloud security, governance, and cost optimization standards?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Cloud deployment includes security controls (encryption, IAM, network isolation), governance (tagging, monitoring), and cost optimization (auto-scaling, rightsizing)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Cloud deployment lacks security, governance, or cost optimization measures
validation_rules.na_criteria: On-premise deployment with documented exception
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Cloud compliance controls not documented in Section 4 (High-Level Architecture)

validation_items.question: Is the architecture aligned with documented business strategy and enterprise goals?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Clear alignment documented between architecture and business strategy (digital transformation, customer experience, operational efficiency, etc.)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No linkage to business strategy or misalignment with enterprise goals
validation_rules.na_criteria: Regulatory or compliance-driven project with no strategic component
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Strategic alignment not documented in Section 2 (Problem Statement)

validation_items.question: Are expected business outcomes and value metrics clearly defined?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Business outcomes documented with measurable KPIs (revenue impact, cost savings, efficiency gains, customer satisfaction, time-to-market)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No business outcomes or metrics defined
validation_rules.na_criteria: Technical infrastructure project with indirect business value
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Value metrics not documented in Section 3 (Business Context)

validation_items.question: Is the architecture connected to specific strategic initiatives or enterprise programs?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Architecture supports identified strategic initiatives (e.g., cloud migration, data modernization, customer platform)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No connection to strategic initiatives
validation_rules.na_criteria: Tactical project not tied to strategic program
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Strategic initiative linkage not documented in Section 2 (Problem Statement)

validation_items.question: Are all technology components within supported lifecycle (no end-of-life or deprecated technologies)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: All technology components have active vendor support with documented end-of-support dates at least 2+ years out; no deprecated technologies
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Use of end-of-life, deprecated, or unsupported technologies without migration plan
validation_rules.na_criteria: Legacy modernization project replacing obsolete technologies
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Technology lifecycle status not documented in Section 8 (Technology Stack)

validation_items.question: Are end-of-support dates tracked for all components with proactive replacement planning?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: End-of-support tracking documented with proactive replacement strategy before EOL (12+ months advance planning)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No end-of-support tracking or reactive replacement approach
validation_rules.na_criteria: All components using evergreen cloud services with no EOL dates
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: End-of-support planning not documented in Section 12 (Architectural Decisions)

validation_items.question: Is there a documented upgrade and patching strategy to maintain currency?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Upgrade roadmap documented with regular patching cadence (monthly security patches, quarterly feature updates)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No upgrade strategy or outdated patching approach
validation_rules.na_criteria: Fully managed SaaS with vendor-controlled updates
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Upgrade roadmap not documented in Section 12 (Architectural Decisions)

validation_items.question: Are data governance policies defined including ownership, stewardship, and access controls?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Data governance framework documented with data owners, stewards, classification (PII, confidential, public), and access control policies
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No data governance or unclear ownership and access controls
validation_rules.na_criteria: Stateless application with no persistent data storage
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Data governance not documented in Section 6 (Data Architecture)

validation_items.question: Is data lifecycle management defined (creation, retention, archival, deletion)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Data lifecycle policies documented with retention periods, archival strategy, and deletion procedures compliant with regulations (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No data lifecycle management or retention policies
validation_rules.na_criteria: Stateless application with no persistent data storage
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Data lifecycle not documented in Section 9 (Non-Functional Requirements)

validation_items.question: Are data quality controls and validation mechanisms defined?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Data quality framework documented with validation rules, data profiling, cleansing processes, and quality metrics
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No data quality controls or validation mechanisms
validation_rules.na_criteria: Application does not manage master or reference data
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Data quality controls not documented in Section 6 (Data Architecture)

validation_items.question: Are backup, disaster recovery, and business continuity plans documented for data?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Backup strategy documented with RPO/RTO targets, disaster recovery procedures, and business continuity testing plan
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No backup or disaster recovery plan for critical data
validation_rules.na_criteria: Stateless application with no persistent data storage
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Backup and recovery not documented in Section 9 (Non-Functional Requirements)

validation_items.question: Are all integrations and service interactions designed using API-first principles?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: API-first design with documented RESTful/GraphQL APIs, OpenAPI/Swagger specs, versioning strategy, and developer portal
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Point-to-point integrations, direct database access, or file-based integration without API layer
validation_rules.na_criteria: Standalone application with no integration requirements
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: API strategy not documented in Section 7 (Integration Architecture)

validation_items.question: Are asynchronous and real-time requirements implemented using selective async patterns?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Event-driven architecture documented with message brokers (Kafka, RabbitMQ, Azure Service Bus), event schemas, and publish-subscribe patterns
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Synchronous polling or batch processing where real-time events are more appropriate
validation_rules.na_criteria: No real-time or asynchronous integration requirements
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Event-driven architecture not documented in Section 4 (High-Level Architecture)

validation_items.question: Do APIs and events follow enterprise interoperability standards (JSON, REST, event schemas)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Interoperability standards documented with JSON/XML schemas, REST compliance (HTTP verbs, status codes), and enterprise event catalog
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Proprietary protocols or non-standard data formats without justification
validation_rules.na_criteria: Standalone application with no integration requirements
validation_rules.unknown_criteria: Interoperability standards not documented in Section 7 (Integration Architecture)

8.0-10.0.message: High confidence validation. Enterprise Architecture contract automatically approved with full LAE compliance.

7.0-7.9.message: Validation passed with minor gaps. Ready for Enterprise Architecture Review Board evaluation.

5.0-6.9.message: Enterprise Architecture incomplete. Address LAE compliance gaps before submission.
blockers: Must document modularity and capability reusability (LAE1)

0.0-4.9.message: Insufficient Enterprise Architecture compliance. Cannot proceed without fundamental LAE adherence.
blockers: Multiple architectural domains missing or inadequate
Business alignment and technical standards not documented

remediation_guidance.FAIL_items: Document all 7 LAE requirements with comprehensive coverage: modularity, third-party strategy, cloud-first, business alignment, zero obsolescence, managed data, and API-first/async decoupling architecture
remediation_guidance.UNKNOWN_items: Add enterprise architecture details to ARCHITECTURE.md covering all LAE domains: Sections 2-3 (strategy/business), 4 (architecture), 5 (components), 6 (data), 7 (integration), 8 (technology), 9 (NFRs), 12 (decisions)
remediation_guidance.completeness_below_threshold: Complete all 7 LAE validation sections with specific evidence from ARCHITECTURE.md sections
remediation_guidance.low_quality_score: Improve traceability by explicitly referencing ARCHITECTURE.md sections for each LAE requirement with direct quotes and page numbers
